discoveredAssets: localhost:5001 - Dalgona Challenges CTF Web Application (Werkzeug 3.1.3, Python 3.13.3) - Port 5001, HTTP
xss25 Challenge - Primary XSS vulnerability challenge endpoint at /xss25 - Featured on homepage
xss3 Challenge - Hidden XSS vulnerability challenge endpoint at /xss3 - Not listed in navigation
Static Resources Directory - /static/* resources (CSS, images, favicon) - Directory browsing disabled

targets.objective: Test XSS Challenge #25 for functionality, input validation, output encoding, and XSS vulnerability exploitation techniques. Analyze form submission behavior, JavaScript handling, and DOM-based XSS patterns.
targets.rationale: Primary featured challenge on the application homepage. Key entry point for understanding the application's security testing capabilities and identifying potential vulnerabilities in XSS handling, client-side processing, and form submission workflows.

targets.objective: Test XSS Challenge #3 for functionality, input validation, client-side JavaScript processing, and XSS evasion techniques. Compare vulnerability patterns with xss25 to identify challenge progression and security level differences.
targets.rationale: Hidden challenge discovered through enumeration. Allows testing of application consistency, validation logic across multiple challenges, and potential privilege escalation or unauthorized access patterns to hidden content.

targets.objective: Test homepage for information disclosure, hidden challenge enumeration, client-side functionality, and potential IDOR or authorization bypass patterns. Analyze challenge list generation and visibility controls.
targets.rationale: Application root endpoint. Serves as entry point for understanding application logic, challenge management, and potential enumeration of hidden or restricted challenges. Test for information leakage that could reveal additional challenge endpoints.

keyFindings: [MEDIUM] Dalgona Challenges CTF application running on localhost:5001 with minimal security configuration
[MEDIUM] Only GET, OPTIONS, HEAD methods allowed - POST returns 405 Method Not Allowed on all endpoints
[LOW] XSS Challenge #3 exists but is hidden from homepage navigation - discovered through systematic endpoint enumeration
[LOW] Static resources directory exists but browsing is disabled - individual file access appears to be restricted
[LOW] No exposed API endpoints - /api, /api/v1, /graphql all return 404
[LOW] No sensitive configuration files exposed - .git, .env, robots.txt, sitemap.xml all return 404
[LOW] Application uses simple static HTML forms without visible JavaScript or dynamic form submission actions
[INFO] Web server: Werkzeug 3.1.3 (Python Flask development server) / Python 3.13.3
[INFO] Attack surface limited - only 3 main entry points identified (/, /xss3, /xss25)
